title: Swim Through Burning Oil on Water Surface
brief: Escape from surface oil fires by swimming underwater and clearing burning areas before surfacing.
steps: Step 1: Discard shoes and buoyant life preserver (keep uninflated life preserver if available).
Step 2: Cover nose, mouth, and eyes and quickly go underwater.
Step 3: Swim underwater as far as possible before needing to surface for air.
Step 4: While still underwater, use hands to push burning fluid away from area where you'll surface.
Step 5: Once area is clear of burning liquid, surface and take a few breaths facing downwind.
Step 6: Submerge feet first and repeat process until completely clear of flames.
warnings: Only discard buoyant life preserver in oil fire situations - keep uninflated ones.
Always face downwind before inhaling when surfacing to avoid smoke inhalation.
Get clear of fuel-covered water immediately in case fuel ignites.
